title.narrative: Technical Assistance Program Implementation and Capacity Building Support for Multiple Emphasis Areas in the Republic of Zambia

description.narrative:
Prevention of Mother-to-Child Transmission (PMTCT): provide supportive supervision of service providers; develop on-the-job training and distance learning programs to build capacity; and integrate PMTCT and malaria in pregnancy services.
Male circumcision (MC): expand comprehensive MC services; train counselors and clinicians; implement an MC communication strategy; and engage women to support MC.
Palliative care: introduce the “single visit approach” to cervical cancer screening; scale up cervical cancer prevention services.
HIV treatment services: finalize and implement the draft pediatric antiretroviral therapy (ART) communication strategy with the MOH and NAC; support efforts to monitor quality of care in ART services; facilitate use of technology to disseminate and make available clinical guidelines and resources.
Tuberculosis (TB): build capacity and expand integration of HIV and TB services; improve infection prevention; strengthen and expand capacity in training skills, supervision, and monitoring; and help improve diagnosis and treatment of TB in HIV-infected and exposed children.
HIV counseling and testing: promote task-shifting where possible; provide training for lay counselors; and mobilize and engage communities in the promotion of HCT. Strategic information: support the scale-up and implementation of SmartCare through clinical training, supportive supervision, curriculum review, and site readiness.
Human capacity development and training: identify gaps; build capacity in curriculum development and instructional design; conduct technical updates; improve teaching ability; and help MOH fight attrition.
Target groups are dependent on focus area but include: HIV-positive individuals, clients on ART, pregnant women, adolescent boys and men
